page.title: 18THE CHURCHES 1
page.content: There are three churches in the area. Two of which are used as religious communities and the third of which is now a private dwelling. Little Wenlock has St. Lawrence's church, which is on a medieval site, but which was built mainly in 1865. There are services there now once every three weeks, rotated with the churches in Coalbrookdale and Ironbridge. Nearby is an imposing seventeenth century manor house and the rectory, now privately owned, but still the site of the annual garden fete. Also built in 1865, fashioned in red brick, was St. John the Evangelist Church, Lawley. Next to it is the rectory, which is now the home of four monks, who are members of the brotherhood the Community of the Glorious Ascension. They have a chapel in the rectory, where they worship
